attributes.action: All Government ministers should resign if they do not back a no deal Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit was described as a “divorce” from the EU. Therefore, to date, ministers should only have been dealing with any laws, regulations and practicalities necessary to enable the U.K. to continue “business as usual” on the leave date. “The separation agreement”. 
Only after leaving should any negotiations on the the actual terms have been negotiated. “The divorce”
It’s really not that difficult. How dare Ministers presume to know better than those who put them in their jobs in the first place.
attributes.background:
Since the EU referendum ministers have increasingly decided that “they know” that those who voted to leave the EU did not vote for no deal. This is factually incorrect. 
All ministers working to stop Brexit should immediately apologise to the country and resign.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments, which includes calling for someone to lose their job.
